org.ensor.algorithms.astar.grid

Class HexMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.algorithms.astar.grid.GridMap
      • org.ensor.algorithms.astar.grid.HexMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMap<GridMover,GridNode>

    public class HexMap
extends GridMap
    This map implements the semantics of a hexagonal grid for the purpose of graph node traversal. The grid is implemented by an underlying square grid where certain diagonal moves are permitted.
    Author:
    Jon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HexMap()
      This method constructs the hexagonal grid map based on the underlying GridMap implementation.

      This method calculates the cost of traversing from the start node to the end node for the given mover.
      Collection<GridNode> getNeighbors(GridMover mover, GridNode node)

    • Method Detail

      • getNeighbors

        public Collection<GridNode> getNeighbors(GridMover mover,
                                GridNode node)
        This method returns the set of neighbors of the current node which can be reached by the specified mover. The set of nodes is the 6 nodes top, bottom, left, right, upper-left, lower-right.
        Specified by:
        getNeighbors in interface IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
        Specified by:
        getNeighbors in class GridMap
        Parameters:
        mover - The mover which is attempting to move across the nodes.
        node - The node from which to start.
        Returns:
        The list of adjacent nodes which can be reached from this node by this mover.

      • getCost

        public double getCost(GridMover mover,
             GridNode startNode,
             GridNode endNode)
        This method calculates the cost of traversing from the start node to the end node for the given mover.
        Specified by:
        getCost in interface IMap<GridMover,GridNode>
        Overrides:
        getCost in class GridMap
        Parameters:
        mover - The mover traversing the path.
        startNode - The start node to traverse.
        endNode - The end node to traverse.
        Returns:
        The cost of the mover going from startNode to endNode.
